meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in avoiding bad luck or a curse.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outjinx all her friends by carrying a lucky charm everywhere.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outjinx any potential misfortune by knocking on wood.
meanings.sent3: In a playful game, she tried to outjinx the black cat by throwing salt over her shoulder.
meanings.sent4: The rabbit's foot seemed to outjinx any bad luck that came his way.
meanings.sent5: Her lucky penny outjinxed any curse that dared to approach her.

meanings.definition: To outsmart or outwit someone in a superstitious context.
meanings.sent1: He was able to outjinx his opponent by avoiding all the cracks on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She tried to outjinx her brother by crossing her fingers during the test.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox managed to outjinx the hunter by leading him in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking outjinxed the old superstitions that haunted the town.
meanings.sent5: The lucky charm seemed to outjinx any attempt to trick its owner.
